option: The maximum number of discrete values that can be listed (enumerated) from the computed bounds on some expression. Such lists are used mainly to resolve dynamic jumps and mainly switch/case statements, where this number sets a limit on the number of case branches enumerated from the bounds deduced for the switch index expression. This limit guards against generating over-estimated control-flow graphs with millions of branches, which could otherwise happen if the analysis cannot find good bounds on such expressions.
